title: Questions for the new zed ult passive
body:
I have 2 questions: 
one: Does the ult mark need to proc, meaning only the ult proc will give ad
two: How much ad will you gain?

replies.body:
Targets killed by the ult or targets who die with the ult on them.

AD bonus is based off the target's AD (so you'll really want to go Jhin killing).

Wasn't scaling on enemy stats considered toxic and a reason Veigar's ultimate got reworked? Just curious, if that is the case what made you try this approach on Zed?

Especially considering that this seems like a more extreme version of the same problem. If one person built heavy AP, Veigar's ult would punish that person and that person alone - while new Zed's ult can feed of a single heavy AD champion's damage and apply it to anyone.

Can we not joke about this interaction and change it so it applies before Jhin's multiplied AD. You guys have always talked about how you don't want games to be won or lost at champ select, then you create this interaction. Zed vs Jhin is going to be utterly unstoppable if he ever kills Jhin, which isn't the hardest thing to do.
Then dont pick jhin if you feel you cant prevent a zed from killing you or if they have already selected zed. or just ban zed.

>or just ban zed.

Yep, that's what everyone already does and what people will continue to do until Riot addresses Zed's manaless waveclear, which is his actual problem.
his problem is that he his laning is as safe as a lux or ahri while being an assassin

He'll get like 25 AD off of a 500 AD Jhin (according to Surr@20 5% of target's AD). It's not going to make him unstoppable, his current Passive gives him more free AD than his ult will in most cases.

Only situation in which that changes is if the ratio scales with ult levels, in which case it'd be problematic because it does create a Veigar Ult situation all over again: Zed passively punishes you for playing Jhin, or any champion that builds a lot of AD.

You're misreading the S@20 post. 

https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-napatUeSjg4/WAa2fAOR_mI/AAAAAAAAWWQ/Q5Kb6unHto05ujV6sSRi-8JXsYHVffacwCLcB/s1600/zedr.jpg

5+5%, 10% at rank 1, what this probably means is 5+5/10/15% for each rank, or 10/15/20% of their AD. Against a 500 AD Jhin that's just a casual 100 AD, realistcally more since 500 AD is low end for a late game Jhin.

Even against a regular ADC that could be 60 extra AD, that's like having a whole extra item. Zed's going to be back to permabanned status again after these changes, because something you didn't think about, Zed has 2 points in R at 11, that's a 15% bonus from R when he'd normally have a 5% bonus from W.

>Zed passively punishes you for playing Jhin, or any champion that builds a lot of AD. 

Remember what Riot said when Veigar did the same thing for AP champs?
Got one thing wrong, it means 5 flat ad + ad%. Not 5% +ad%. So say you have 2 points in ult (10%) an proc on a 200 ad champ, you get 10% (20)+5 flat ad. Not 15% of 200 which would be 30 ad.
I read it as gaining 5 AD + 5% of his target's AD. Doesn't make sense to not just say "10%".

It's not uncommon for these tooltips to be super clunky when they release. I remember in the mid season there was something similar on Protobelt I think that wound up being cleared up later. Either way assuming 5% seems wrong since it's going to be at least 5 flat +5/10/15%.
Just 5%?  That's not bad at all.

To be fair, if you are in a similar fed status as Zed as Jhin you have options to deal with him. It requires a lot of coordination from you and your team if something goes odd. If you can root him and move away you can try to kill him before he does. It's not going to work 100% but Zed too won't be 100% accurate in what he does.
But sometimes when I kill them with the ult on them or the ult kills them, I dont get extra ad? Also will marked people that are killed by teammates give u extra ad

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=G1Ygzfy7,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-10-19T00:21:15.942+0000)
>
> Targets killed by the ult or targets who die with the ult on them.
> 
> AD bonus is based off the target's AD (so you'll really want to go Jhin killing).

Am I the only one who thinks Jinx having such high amounts of AD is getting problematic (notably with DFT and the interaction with Zed now)?
Though the option of his AD staying normal and instead his autoattacks dealing damage in % (superior to 100) of his AD, increasing with crit and AS would not be very intuitive.
Is this permanently stacking AD or a momentary buff to keep Zed going in the fights after obliterating the ADC?

Death Mark (R) !

    [Strongest = "Any target that will provide him a greater Attack Damage bonus than what currently possess. He can only be gaining damage from single enemy champion at a time. If Death Mark nets him a kill or assist on a target that will provide him with a higher bonus, he gains Attack Damage from them instead."]
    [5/10/15% AD gained]
    [Zed can only gain AD from one enemy champion at a time. If target buys more AD, Zed needs to kill them again with R to get a stronger buff.] 

Source : http://www.surrenderat20.net/2016/10/1018-pbe-update.html
So why this change? What makes him not a generalist assassin? How is he different than Rengar's old method of hunting the same person?

Is there a cap to how much he can gain or will his AD keep growing by killing the same unlucky ADC 24/7?

I assume this change makes him weaker against teams not stacking AD while making him stronger vs AD heavy teams.

~~Tell me this isn't accurate.~~

~~Its just bonus AD based on the target, right?~~

Someone was just exaggerating. 

____________

~~Also, Darius is a good contender as well. How does that work though?~~

~~Would it use the ADC/Assassin's AD until Darius proc's his passive, then Darius' would take over, or does it only over-write when you kill the target with the current highest AD?~~

~~Could ulting Darius negatively affect you in many cases, then?~~

~~I smell spaghetti already. ~~

Its AD at the time of kill; Meddler confirmed guys. That's a relief. Takes away a lot of needless complication.
If they make his ult so that its dmg would get reflected by thornmail, then he wouldn't be so strong anymore, then he would be way more balanced and not banned so much :-)

He has to kill them with it, but he'll probably get ~1s lee way for assists.
Numbers aren't released yet.
